creator: eric_97@pobox.com
text:
Perform a number of test runs, without clearing the results between them.  The
throughput graph (in Graph Results) drops sharply at the very start of each run
-- a nice clean square-wave edge.

Hypothesis: The idle time between the end of one run and the start of the next
is being included in the throughput calculation.

Fixing this will be a bear, unfortunately.  For now, all I can say is mixing the
results from two test runs is not a valid thing to do.
creator: mstover1@apache.org

text:
A possible fix would be to always make a "Clear all" before starting a test.

Setting Priority to Low.
creator: jsalvata@atg.com
mstover1@apache.org
text:
I'm changing this to an enhancement request - to allow two separate test runs to
be combined.  It requires adding meta data to a test run, and additional logic
in some of the listeners.  But, it would be a good thing to do.

Closing as WONTFIX this old bug:
- User know they can clear
- Using this element means GUI mode for load testing which is a Bad practice
- We have not Web report
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
